CONSTRUCTION MANAGER

SUMMARY

Energetic Construction Manager consistently involved in all facets of the project.
Extremely knowledgeable in Pipe lines,  gas and oil facility's and Mining industry regulations and construction, providing expert direction in all aspects of  contract construction. Strong leadership and communication skill.
I am able to recognize problems and solve them and a full understanding the important of forming a strong relationship with the owners and engineers for the good of the project and future work.
I work close with the safety side of the projects with a understanding how important safety is for the crew and the company.
Highlights
MSHA Certified OSHA Certified Twic Certified
Safety oriented
Specifications API 6A; 5L; 15D; 1104; 653 ASTM A36; A350; A694;392; AWS D1.!
Strong management skills Project budgeting Scheduling
communication skills
Able to form a strong and experienced team for all phases of the project
Work close with the contractors
Computer strong
Clear and strong Verbal skills
Very oriented and organized

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Managed  $20m to 120m projects, while supervising a team of 40 to 265 workers.
I have a proven record of safe job sites, I have the ability to form a safe environment for our contractors and team safety is first.
All jobs have come in on time and on budget.
1. Managed safe job sites.
2.
Managed shut downs at Kennecott mine, Barrick Gold strike, GSL, all mining.
3. Managed several Tank farms API 650, 653, 620, 651,652

Managed Pipe line projects from start to finish.
5. Managed new facilities civil, pipe, structural, Tanks

<JD_START>
Job Title: Safety Manager

Location: Plattsburgh, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Other, Project Management

Description:
CONSTRUCTION SAFETY MANAGER
SUMMARY OF POSITIONAssist the Project Safety Team with implementation/application of all required federal and corporate safety policies. Promote a safe working environment by helping to minimize risk. Monitor jobsites to eliminate hazardous activities. This position will require travel and stay-away when necessary. This is position will have opportunities for overtime and weekend work. (This will be a must!)
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESPerform site safety audits.Provide/schedule necessary safety training to employees.Maintain all safety training records.Perform accident/near miss investigations. This will include root cause analysis.Mitigation of all identified hazards.Maintain safety supply stock and order when necessary.Manage the company safety assets.Provide requested safety equipment in the field.On-boarding and orientation of all new employees.Help maintain compliance and qualification requirements (ISNetworld, Energy Worldnet, Veriforce, etc.).Point of contact for all accident/incident reporting and communication to corporate office.Review weekly toolbox talks with employees. Lead all morning start-up meetings.Visit jobsites on an as needed basis.Communicate with jobs and shops regularly to make sure needs are fulfilled.

QUALIFICATIONSStrong communication skills, both written and verbalGood people skills with a “team player”3-5 years of industry experienceComputer skills (MS Office)OSHA 30, First Aid/CPR, CHST or other is helpfulCompliance management experience is helpfulAbility to travel to jobsitesBilingual (English/Spanish) is beneficialValid DL and clean driving record with the ability to be added to our insurance
WORKING CONDITIONS – Work will be full time in the field with occasional office work.. Office environment is climate controlled and work is sedentary. Shops and jobsites are outdoors. Hot, cold, dirty, dusty, wet, muddy conditions can be present.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS – Employee must be able to lift 50 pounds frequently and 50+ pounds occasionally. Must be able to wear all required personal protective equipment.
Each candidate for this position will be given a pre-employment drug screening.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, eVerify, and a drug free workplace.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
